intro: Verbesina smithii, commonly known as the Smith's beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread in suitable environments.
